5.THE CASE OF POSITIVE SQUAREFREE $D$ AND FINAL REMARKS

A natural question to ask is what happens when we consider discriminants $D > 4$ where the same equivalence relations $\textcircled{1}$ hold. In this case, the constant term $1 6 D ^ { \prime } = - 1 6 \cdot 3 D$ of our elliptic curves $E _ { D ^ { \prime } } ^ { \prime }$ would be negative.
